text.__SUMMARY__: Allium oreophilum, common name pink lily leek, is a plant species native to Xinjiang, Afghanistan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Pakistan, Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, Iran, Iraq, Turkmenistan, European Russia, Turkey, Azerbaijan, Armenia, GeorgiaAllium oreophilum produces one spherical bulb up to 2 cm (2⁄3 in) in diameter. Scape is short for the genus, rarely more than 20 cm (8 in) tall. Leaves are flat, narrow, longer than the scape. Umbel has 10–15 red flowers.
text.External links: photo of herbarium specimen at Missouri Botanical Garden, isotype of Allium oreophilum, collected from the Caucasus region
